Author.name: David Crocker gave excellent support on Perfect Developer
Steffen Schlager offered helpful instructions on KeY

Section.title: ¬ NOT & ∧ AND => ∨ OR <=> ⊃ IMPLIES ⇐⇒ IFF ∀ FORALL ∃ EXISTS λ LAMBDA

Reference.title: y): mult(x, y, 0) = x * y END mult Proof procedure mult-test: (grind) mult-ok: (induct-and-simplify "y") mult-add: (induct-and-simplify "y") mult-ok2: (skosimp*) (rewrite "mult-ok" :subst ("z" 0)) Analysis Sort a sequence of numbers according to the well known Quicksort algorithm developed by Tony Hoare. This example is due to Griffioen and Huisman
Reference.referenceText: ref1,FORALL, 1998,y): mult(x, y, 0) = x * y END mult Proof procedure mult-test: (grind) mult-ok: (induct-and-simplify "y") mult-add: (induct-and-simplify "y") mult-ok2: (skosimp*) (rewrite "mult-ok" :subst ("z" 0)) Analysis Sort a sequence of numbers according to the well known Quicksort algorithm developed by Tony Hoare. This example is due to Griffioen and Huisman,mult-ok2 LEMMA FORALL,1998
